docs.snippet: The quartet of technology stocks that has driven Wall Street indices to record highs in recent years may be breaking up, possibly undermining one of the best growth stories in a nine-year bull market.

headline.print_headline: Wall Street's Beloved FANG Stock Quartet May Be Breaking Up
headline.main: Wall Street's Beloved FANG Stock Quartet May Be Breaking Up

docs.snippet: Google said that the new policy will come into effect in June on its own platforms and on third-party websites where it sells advertising space.

headline.print_headline: Google Bans Bitcoin Advertisements in Policy Change
headline.main: Google Bans Bitcoin Advertisements in Policy Change

docs.snippet: A Colorado company specializes in honey from around the country while supporting an initiative to promote pollination for bees and butterflies.

headline.print_headline: To Drizzle: Spreading Raw Honey Across the Country

docs.snippet: Anyone tempted to #DeleteFacebook after the personal data of millions of users fell into the hands of a political consultancy is still likely to be monitored by the social network, which tracks nearly 30 percent of global website traffic.

headline.print_headline: #DeleteFacebook? Privacy Proves Hard to Protect Online
headline.main: #DeleteFacebook? Privacy Proves Hard to Protect Online

docs.snippet: A new offering from the Museum of Modern Art takes the guess work out of your macchiato.

headline.print_headline: The Mug That Makes Everyone a Barista
headline.main: The Mug That Makes Everyone a Barista

docs.snippet: Safe Catch, a canning company that tests for mercury levels, now sells wild pink salmon in addition to sustainably caught tuna.

headline.print_headline: To Serve: A Canned Salmon Gets Put to the Test
headline.main: Canned Salmon With Lower Mercury Levels

docs.snippet: A Miami Republican congresswoman is defending a well-known Florida school shooting survivor from another lawmaker who attacked her for wearing a Cuban flag patch as she advocated for gun control in Washington.

headline.print_headline: Republican Lawmaker Defends Parkland Student's Cuban Flag
headline.main: Republican Lawmaker Defends Parkland Student's Cuban Flag

docs.snippet: U.S. stocks sank on Monday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average shedding nearly 400 points, as Facebook led a selloff in technology stocks on reports that the social media company's user information was misused.

headline.print_headline: Analyst View: Tech Sector Selloff Leads Wall Street Sharply Lower
headline.main: Analyst View: Tech Sector Selloff Leads Wall Street Sharply Lower
Krugman’s Taking Your Questions on Trade

docs.snippet: The California-based Shed restaurant offers up meaty slices of mushrooms that go nicely on an antipasto platter, sandwiches or seared fish.

headline.print_headline: To Nibble: Slices of Shiitake With a Salty Tang
headline.main: Pickled Shiitake Mushrooms With a Salty Tang
